result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittany K. Kopp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 11/20/17: The Court extends the Probation term for one year.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution in the amount of $68.49 to Pick N Save
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee

--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

--Per Standing Order Defendant to pay $10 drug offender diversion surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 per Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores, except for employment purposes as Agent approves
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent

The Court grants Ms. Kopp expungement upon successful completion of Probation.

Arresting Agency: Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

[MK; Court Reporter- Lisa Nugent] case called at 2:35pm 
Defendant Brittany K. Kopp in court, in custody, with Attorney Joseph Fischer.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing arguments are given by counsel. 
Ms. Kopp makes a statement. 

On Count #1 the Court sentences Ms. Kopp to:
--serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail ; time served 

On Count #2 the Court sentences Ms. Kopp to:
--serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail concurrent; time served 

Days credit for time already served given:  48 days 

The Court orders a civil judgment on all outstanding court financial obligation.  
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for the supervision fees amount. 
recess 2:56pm.

records.addlTxt: with elements and criminal case settlement

Case called at 9:10am [mo]
Defendant Brittany K. Kopp in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Counts #1 and #2; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #3 and #4

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 
Statement made by Ms. Kopp

Upon agreement of the Parties, the Court finds that the restitution amount owed to Pick N Save is $68.49 and orders that Ms. Kopp pay the restitution amount during her term of Probation.

On Counts #1 and #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores, except for employment purposes as Agent approves
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--On Count #1: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #2: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay restitution in the amount of $68.49 to Pick N Save
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
The Court grants Ms. Kopp expungement upon successful completion of Probation.
recess: 9:36am

[MK] case called at 2: 43pm. 
Defendant Brittany K. Kopp in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense.
The Court charges Attorney Hagemann with checking on the booking process and tracking this to ensure that the fingerprint card is filed. 
recess 2:45 pm. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/14/15 at 9:40am  (2)  Status Conference on 11/24/15 at 9:00am.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 2:34pm. 
Brittany K. Kopp in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Ms. Kopp verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
After Ms. Kopp indicates that she intends to seek counsel, the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance. 
The Court orders Ms. Kopp to go to the Jefferson Public Defender's Office today to make arrangements for an eligibility determination to be done. 

The Court requires $1,000  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with Alyson Bates
--no presence at the Pick N Save in Watertown
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
recess 2:42pm. 


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 9/22/15 at 2:00pm
